medical_history.chief_complaint: Delayed posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms occurring more than 30 years after combat.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initially asymptomatic for over 30 years after World War II. Symptoms of PTSD began in 1976 following retirement and health deterioration, including nightmares about combat occurring once or twice a week. Nightmares intensified to four times a week after a trip to Europe in 1979, including distressing themes involving his grandchildren.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes mellitus, hypertension, type V hyperlipoproteinemia, retinopathy, peripheral neuropathy, myocardial infarction, and leg ulcers.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of cancer in 1952; father died of heart disease in 1962. No significant prolonged emotional reaction noted to their deaths.
medical_history.social_history: No history of smoking, alcohol consumption, or drug use. Worked successfully as an architect until forced retirement due to health issues; previously active in military alumni organizations.
